name: Bleecker Street Pizza
address: 69 7th Ave S, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text: Me encantÃ³ la pizza, pedÃ­ la nonna con vegetales, sÃºper recomendable!! El personal fue muy amable!
Best pizza in the world
No, tutaj trzeba koniecznie przyjÅ›Ä‡ ğŸ˜‰ pizza jest fantastyczna i bardzo smaczna.

Best late night snack! And this is a great spot for it. I admit that I was skeptical and didnâ€™t think I would eat a whole slice. Ended up eating a slice and a half. We could have eaten a whole pizza. Great crust!! toppings simple and tasty. Long lines but it moves fast. Lot of people grab and go. They are making the pizzas fresh. Very tasty, very NYC, pop in and get two or 3 slices!
top atmosphere and nice service! vibes are insane- mediocre pizza thoo
Unreal! Loved it and was everything Iâ€™d hoped travelling to the UK. One of the best pizzas Iâ€™ve ever had.
An amazing place - plenty of history and delicious food. Met Gregg the original owner of Bleeker St Pizza - awesome guy. Definitely worth a visit
My girlfriend and I brought our nephews and the food was incredible as always. Greg the owner is very friendly and has great customer service. Our favorite pizza ever! Best in NYC!!!!
EXCELLENT pizza! That nona Maria is something else
We got the tomato basil and mushroom slices and garlic knots. All of them were yummy! The place can be a bit crowded but it's all about the vibes ;)
Nona Maria slice was delicious! Staff was very friendly. Iâ€™ll definitely eat here again!

Pizza lives up to the hype, staff was fun and engaging even when crazy busy.  Line was present but moved fast.  We went twice over a weekend because the pizza was so good.  It was better on Saturday when they were slammed vs when they were slow.  I think it simply is just better to have super fresh vs sitting in the window for any length of time.  If you go on a slower day consider ordering a whole pie fresh vs individual slices.  Big difference when it was fresh out in taste and quality.
Deliciosa pizza estilo NY, con masa crujiente. El lugar se llena, pero el servicio es rÃ¡pido y eficiente.
Very good pizza, probably one of the best in NYC

I was so fortunate to meet Greg my first time here. He was so kind and funny and shared amazing stories of this place. He even offered to take a picture of us. The pizza is fantastic, the people are great, I will be coming back again!
A slice of Nonna Maria pizza is a a must when in NYC.  If your lucky enough to meet Greg, tell him bill from Hermosa Beach says hello
Amazing Taste!!! Best Pizza in my life!
Extremely delicious pizza
Da best pizza
Mediocre pizza
Best pizza I had when I visited NYC, hands down. Trying the Nonna Maria is a must!
Absolutely delicious and talking with Greg was a delight! Nonnaâ€™s sauceâ€¦.soooooooo good!

Best slice in NYC!!  The Nona Maria slice did not disappoint!  Greg was so kind and so welcoming!  Told us the story behind the Nona Maria recipe. He even took a picture with me and then took a picture of us. Greg was the best!!

Espectacular LA NONA MARÃA!!!!

Saludos desde EspaÃ±a y volveremos de nuevo!!!
Great pizza. Wait time to place an order was apx 10 minutes, served additional 3-4 minutes. Another 5-10 minutes to find a table.
Iâ€™m mad that this place doesnâ€™t show up when you search for pizza, but I guess thatâ€™s how they keep it affordable for all the locals. Thank you Amir for showing me this gem!
This place has delicious pizza, it was a bit busy, but we got a table right away and we didn't have to wait too long to get our pizza.
We had the nona maria, pepperoni and white pie. Nona maria was my fav. Unique! The rest were ok. Texture is great though.

In my Summer 2025 Pizza Top 5 list, Bleecker Street Pizza comes in third place.

Bleecker St. Pizza is hyped by several NYC bloggers. I can understand the hype. The slices are very tasty. I had a Margerita (Cheese) a Peperoni with Jelapenos. The crust is a bit too crispy for me and the Mozzarella dominates the slices. The tomato sauce is great. OMG, the jelapenos blew me away - I thought I was used to hot food. I looove the level of spiciness! The ice-cold Coke saved me. The bit too much fat on the pizza can easily be wiped off with napkins. Overall it is a typical NYC pizza with pretty good quality and definitely worth trying.

The shop has two seating areas inside and one outside on the busy 7th Avenue. It's not exactly charming; there are TV screens everywhere and the rooms are very spartanly furnished. Overall, the shop fits in very well with the neighborhood, on the border of East and West Village, where five of New York's top pizzerias are located.

I guess I was very lucky because on my visit there was no waiting line at all!

I recommend Bleecker St. Pizza.
Fell short for my expectations in all honesty. Not bad but definitely not the best either.

Hadn't been in NYC since 2018. That all changed today. Between The New Penn Station remodel and Downtown Congestion Pricing tolls, the city actually seemed a bit quieter, roomier and airy. What better time to soak in this change than to have a slice of Sicilian pizza at the BLEEKER STREET PIZZARIA .
At $7.91 for both Sicilian square and Ginger Ale I actually had a delicious experience . The slice was crunchy (cheese) chewy and the sauce? Don't even go there!!!!, made it all come together. Ambiance was the locals that walked in. I mean I am technically the outter Towner, right?
Appointed seating arrangements with a small step flight up to a few more tables with a TV (not needed with the introduction of the cellphone) comfortable.

*NOTE: THIS ESTABLISHMENT DOES NOT HAVE PATRON BATHROOMS* to which I couldn't understand that one?

Pizzaria does play music, for me a little loud and in some cases not soothing. You will see framed people pictures on the wall showing its heritage, nice touch. All in all a diamond in the "Stuff" like in its fresh food selection.

Avoid driving in "AKA" congestion pricing silly... LOL

From 34th Street Penn Station take the M20 bus at $2.90 from 7th Avenue 34th Street, get off 7th Avenue Barrow Street. Stops directly across the street from the pizzaria. *Remember to walk on Barrow Street to Hudson Street to catch the M20 back to 34th street. Go check them out and tell them the Guru sent you.
PS.. Pizzaria had Graffiti above it, I had to photo shop it out. Owner should paint over itğŸ™‹

The Review Guru*
Long Island NY
If you only go to one pizza place while youâ€™re in New York, go here. Try the Nonna Maria or the Grandma. If youâ€™re there on a Friday, be sure to talk to Greg!

Pizza was average. The crust was surprisingly not so great perhaps because of being reheated multiple times or not being as fresh. It had the same texture as hard toast. Also the flavors did not taste like good quality ingredients. I liked the pizza at Joe's pizza better than this place.

I would not eat here. The attitude and ego of staff are so bad that after years of being a customer, I would never return and walked out telling them to cancel my order. The big White woman with the ponytail is so rude and arrogant in her misery that you lose your appetite near her energy. I stood in front of the register wanting to pay and she ignored me and lied about it when staff asked why I'm cancelling as they seemed surprised I did. You order food and the male staff don't even say thank you anymore or will just have you standing in front of them as they clown around and ignore customers. This place is an ego centric mess that will push away customers over time. It already is happening with the quiet afternoons I've seen.

There are too many wonderful pizza shops in the city to deal with the disrespect and narcissistic behavior. I'd go elsewhere for a more pleasant service.

A very popular pizzeria in the heart of Greenwich Village, right next to the neighborhoodâ€™s famous jazz clubs. Itâ€™s usually packed with people grabbing a slice to go after a night out in the area. They serve delicious pizza with a clear Sicilian influence. The Nonna Maria is a standoutâ€”topped with a rich, homemade tomato sauce that tastes just like a great pasta sauce. We also tried the Sicilian slice, which was another pleasant surprise. Definitely worth a visit if youâ€™re in the neighborhood!

Oh my word! What a place! My wife's Nonna was from Napoli, and she has a very discerning palate; we visited you as part of a food tour of NY, and were not disappointed! The use of panko crumb on your  bases is amazing, but your stroke of genius in layering the cheese before the toppings... INCROYABLE!
No - we didn't take any photos - we were too busy scoffing your incredible pizzas!
Iâ€™m obsessed with the Nonna Maria pizza. Itâ€™s maybe my favorite New York slice.
Stopped by with my friend Eleanor on a Friday for awesome slices and a great chat with the legendary Greg, a previous owner who holds court on Fridays!

While exploring Bleecker Street, we stopped by Bleecker Street Pizza and tried a slice of the Nonna Maria â€” and it was absolutely awesome. The slice was perfectly cooked, flavorful, and easily up there with the best pizza we had in NYC. Unfortunately, we were already full from trying a lot of other places, but Iâ€™m so glad we made room for this one. Definitely a must-visit for pizza lovers in the city.
Amazing Pizzas and Fast Service. Tables inside.
Loved the Nona Maria pizza. Ordered a whole pie and they made it fresh. Really good
Went in late night on a Friday and it hit the spot
PizzerÃ­a tÃ­pica de Nueva York. Una de las pizzas mÃ¡s ricas que he comido, la masa es muy extraÃ±a pero deliciosa, es lo mejor del producto. VolverÃ­a todos los dÃ­as por una pizza

I ordered the Pepperoni square slice and was pleasantly surprised with the flavor. The crunch of the loaded pepperoni and soft chew created the perfect texture and the sauce was spot on! I Loved the pizza and the atmosphere here and will definitely be returning!
Amazing. The best. Iconic.
The cheese slice here is the standard I will hold all others to
Good pizza! The bottom wasnâ€™t soggy like some other pizzas and was a bit crispy. I got the Nonna Maria. The slice was a good size.

Always stop in once a year on a Friday to start our New York weekend trip (coming from VA). Greg is always very welcoming and he's always there when we (fam of 5) stop in. Never been disappointed in anything we order and we've tried every pizza on the menu. This place fills up fast and always so busy but worth it. We always make sure to have left overs to eat at the end of the night (after cruising NY).

Would have posted more photos but the kids already started eating.
The first bite I took I was in heaven. Immediate thoughts were â€˜this is what pizza is supposed to taste like.â€™ A great choice on our first trip to New York!
Not bad. At bit over hyped imo

We went on Saturday night and we queued twice for around 5-10â€™. Not too bad.

The best pizza was the champions ğŸ„â€ğŸŸ« one although a bit too much cheese.

The classic pizza was good but the sauce a bit too sweet for us.

The pepperoni square pizza was not fully cooked. The dough didnâ€™t feel fully cooked. We should have returned it as we didnâ€™t finish it/enjoy it.

We would have preferred if instead of a ricotta, there would have been a pizza with a blue cheese like Gorgonzola for example.

The staff was super kind and the atmosphere inside/outside is very friendly.

Prices arenâ€™t too expensive and thereâ€™s the option of buying slices, which we loved.

Best part? How thin and crunchy the dough was.

Want a classic New York style pizza? Then this place is for you. Get a slice and enjoy it in their small but cozy dining area. The pizza had a nice crust that was slightly crispy and the cheese pizza was really good tasting. I have to say that we tried 3 pizza places while on this trip and this was the best one. Check it out!

I can see why this place was given the award of the best Pizza in NYC! It was fantastic, nice crisp crust, the perfect amount of cheese and such a large slice.

This was my first time here and I would make sure to come back. Friendly staff and quick service was also a plus.

I came here to try the Nonna Maria pizza and im so glad i did because it was very delicious! The ingredients were fresh, sauce was flavorful but not overpowering, and the crust was thin with just the right amount of crisp. Not greasy and itâ€™s cooked perfectly. One of the best tasting pizza i ever had.

The space is tidy with many indoor and outdoor sitting. The staff were friendly and service was quick.

Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

On a corner of Bleecker Street you can visit euphoria if you so choose to. Bleecker Street Pizza is a flavorful punch of a slice, well positioned amongst the hierarchy of New York pizzerias. The inside is unassuming, a lot like a million other places but whatever is going on in that oven is the truth. When we stopped by there was a decent sized line but they do keep it pushing well. Despite the amount of people indoors the place is still pretty clean and there is an order to all the madness going on around you. Lining the walls they have photos of celebrities who made the trek (or swiped a Metrocard) to enjoy a slice here. Like any pizzeria they offer a lot of different slices but since weâ€™ve heard this place was one of the best slices in the city we opted for a regular cheese slice, no frills to make sure we were hearing correctly.

After getting our slice and sitting outside (yes, they do have outdoor seating but it is hard to come by), we were ready to dig in. Hereâ€™s our careful analysis: the crust is undoubtedly New York style. Firm, crisp, not too much give and not burnt to high heavens like a New Haven slice. A little flop to it but a firm underbelly to the slice, which seems like an over evaluation, but trust that it is not. The first bite was incredible. The cheese is stretchy and light, the sauce rich but complimenting the cheese. Easily one of the 3 best pizza slices in our lives based on the first bite alone and by the final bite we were questioning if it was the best period. Needless to say, Bleecker Street Pizza is not an if youâ€™re in the city or an if youâ€™re in the area excursion; this is a go out of your way and eat this slice place. Phenomenal and trying to find excuses to come back for seconds ASAP.
Best pizza Iâ€™ve had so far in NYC. If youâ€™re in Manhattan, you need to stop in and get the Nona slice. Itâ€™s amazing. The crust is light and airy, and the toppings are so incredibly good!

Had the Nonna last time, hence, stopped for a cheese slice.

Both times solid taste, nice crusty and chewy nyc style pizza.  Two slices per visit should be about right amount but I was food hopping so had just one.

Even better was a great conversation I had with Greg, whom I realized later used to run the place but nowadays only comes supervise and QC.

Will definitely come back if in the neighborhood.

Bleecker Street Pizza is a must-visit for anyone looking for a classic New York slice. Located in the heart of the West Village, this small and casual spot serves up thin, crispy, and flavorful pizza that consistently lives up to the hype. The Nonna Maria slice is especially popular and truly delivers â€” rich tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and a perfect crust. Service is quick, and the atmosphere is no-frills, just like a real NYC pizzeria should be. Whether youâ€™re grabbing a late-night bite or a quick lunch, itâ€™s a solid and satisfying choice.

We stumbled upon this place while we were walking around the area. We had the pleasure of meeting Greg, the previous owner who now comes in on Fridays and helps them out! He talked to us about the restaurants history and his brother, and even gave us a postcard that we can take home with us. If youâ€™re able to make it here any day, you definitely should!! The pizza is soooo good (Gregâ€™s families recipes)!! If youâ€™re able to make it on a Friday, even better! Any time we come back to NY, we will visit this spot. ğŸ©·

Bleecker Street Pizza is a NY classic. Visiting town and stopped in. The guys that run this shop are friendly but they offer few modifications so you either like whatâ€™s in the case or head to Joeâ€™s down the street with more options. Personally, I think Bleecker is much better and I donâ€™t think you can go wrong with any of the slices in the case but everyone has a picky friend. Thereâ€™s plenty of room to stand at the table in the middle or the small side tables inside and out. You might wait a few minutes but pizza is a quick meal so table turnover is fast and the guys are good about wiping them down in between. They also sell white claw and beer for anyone looking for a drink with their slice.

A Must-Visit Slice of NYC â€” Great Pizza & Even Better Hospitality!

Bleeker Street Pizza is the perfect spot in the heart of Greenwich Village â€” and an absolute gem! The location is ideal for grabbing a bite while exploring the neighborhood, but what really made our visit special was the hospitality.

Greg was incredibly friendly and made us feel so welcome from the moment we walked in. His warmth and energy gave the place an authentic, inviting vibe that you just donâ€™t find everywhere.

And the pizza? Absolutely amazing. Crispy crust, delicious sauce, and fresh toppings â€” every bite was perfect. We seriously wish we had time to go back for a second visit. Next trip to NYC, this will definitely be a repeat stop!

Been stopping at this place for the last 7 yrs every time I come to N.Y. from Detroit. It never disappoints. We always buy a couple of slices to eat and a couple of pies to take home for the family. Today we had the honor of meeting the owner, Greg. As we enjoyed a slice of their famous Nonna Mariaâ€™s pie, we chatted and he told us all about the history of the pizzeria, his family, his brother, Doug, and their grandma Nonna Maria. It was a pleasure and just made this spot even more special to us now. Great NY pizza, great atmosphere, and great service! Will be back the next time we are in NY and highly recommend this pizzeria to others! Thanks again Greg!

Tried and true slice shop in NYC. It has all the elements that make it a classic pit stop for anyone  living or visiting the city. The vibe is always lively inside and staff will ensure the line keeps moving efficiently. Whether itâ€™s the middle of the day or late at night, I always get a hot and crispy slice here. Thereâ€™s more room inside than you would expect and easy to access all the west village activities.

Bleecker Street Pizza is a NY Classic. I Saw this on a YouTube video and Knew I had to try.  I had tried Joe's Pizza but Personally, I think Bleecker is much better. I tried Nonna Maria and it was Nice big Crispy and Delicious Slices.

I tried all of the pizza places in the area and, although good, this was my least favorite. If you are doing a taste test of the area you should stop by but if you just want one slice there are better places in the area. Donâ€™t get the deep dish here. The rest of the pizza was pretty good.

NYC pizza redemption ğŸ•ğŸ¤¤

This pizza was LIT, great cheese to tomato paste ratio and cooked to perfect.

Iâ€™m not a crust kinda gal so left the crust for my friend to eat.

Great value for money and kept you full for a long time.

If youâ€™re a Swiftie, highly recommend stopping in here after a visit to Cornelia Street.

Pretty pretty, pretty good. Sauce was delicious, crust and cheese were solid. Super friendly service. Iâ€™ll put it down as one of my favorite pizza spots. If youâ€™re close by, definitely check out, but I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way for it. Itâ€™s yummy,  but itâ€™s not a life changing experience

I was trying to find good pizza since Johnâ€™s of Bleeckerâ€™s had a really long line. I didnâ€™t have to go far because this place was right around the corner. There still was a line but it moved fast you can either get a slice which they will warm it up for you, or get a pie which they will make it fresh for you. Let me say they are fast they were getting people in and out and the freshly made pie that I ordered took less than 15 minutes. I got chicken & pepperoni my go to staple. Itâ€™s still a very good pie up there in my books itâ€™s a must try especially how far they get those pies out excellent customer service. They also had a good amount of seating inside and outside.

Tasty pizza joint in the village. The Buffalo chicken pizza was a standout, featuring a bold garlic sauce that added a rich, savory kickâ€”perfectly balanced with the spicy chicken. The veggie pizza was equally impressive, loaded with fresh, vibrant toppings that made every bite satisfying. Great flavors, welcoming vibe, and a must-try for pizza lovers in the area!

Food was quick, atmosphere clean and excellent (really reminiscent of New York!), but the best part would be the pizza.

This very affordable pizza had a delicate crust and each bite had a delicious crunch! The toppings were generous, and Nonna's pizza was so creamy and delicious.

Definitely a must if you are near the West Village and want to try one of NYâ€™s best pizzas (if not the best). There are plenty of options to choose, which in my case I recommend to grab a slice of nonna maria

Bleecker Street Pizza definitely deserves its title of the best pizza in NYC! We ordered slices here for lunch and garlic knots and the flavors were just amazing! The garlic knot was a perfect blend of buttery and garlicky and the pizza crust was the right amount of doughy (and Iâ€™m not usually a pizza crust person)

Had a chicken and ranch pizza slice. Was very nice and unique but bit too crispy for me. The place was empty as it has just opened but staff were nice and friendly. They seemed to be moving stock round and some of the seating area was full of staff and boxes so not amazing but overall the pizza and service was good which is the most important stuff.
